content.content: Photos capture demonstrations held around world to protest against Russian  invasion of Ukraine - ABC News862×485 115 KB  Dear Maker Community, I would like to propose to the Community that Maker lend - within days for obvious reasons - between DAI 1M and 5M - to the Nation of Ukraine. I believe, with the help of the Community, CU’s and delegates, we can make this happen. Should this be something the community agrees with, then Oasis Pro Markets and Monetalis, in collaboration, pledges to act as the “real-world hands” to make it happen. I cannot, exactly, at this hour, tell you what will be the specific means of execution, but I will strive for getting to a situation where, as real-world collateral, we will have a loan obligation from the Nation of Ukraine (preferably a recognized bond) held by a Monetalis-Maker BVI Trust (or similar) structure and then a vault, setup specifically for this situation, and an immediate DAI minting (and probably exchange to USD) and payment. To be clear, this will require some “hustling”, and, very likely, the ultimate solution will involve documentation, governance and structural backfilling post making a payment - due to the obvious time constraints that is around getting such a payment to the right parties. We will have to run this execution a little bit on community trust and faith. This is clearly not an S&P AAA credit opportunity, but, in this case, I choose to believe in the continued existence of Ukraine, and the long-term means and intentions of repaying any debt, Maker may warrant to extend to Ukraine. Unfortunately I cannot make any guarantees that we will succeed in making this happen. This is an exceptionally fluid situation. But I can guarantee we will bring our best game to make this  happen. Given the urgency, you see here two polls, that we will have open only for the next 24 hours.    Should Maker lend DAI to Ukraine ASAP?  Yes No     0 voters        If, Yes, then how much should Maker lend?  DAI 1M DAI 2.5M DAI 5M     0 voters     Thank you for considering this! Monetalis & Oasis Pro Markets @Allan_Pedersen / @OasisProTeam
content.GPT-summary: The author proposes that Maker lend between DAI 1M and 5M to Ukraine, with the help of the community, CU's and delegates. Oasis Pro Markets and Monetalis pledge to act as the "real-world hands" to make it happen. The author acknowledges that this will require some "hustling" and will involve documentation, governance, and structural backfilling post making a payment. The author provides two polls to gauge community interest and feedback.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
None

content.content: DAI SAVES LIVES Overnight this article based on War Bonds was released: Ukraine Raises $270 Million From Sale Of War Bonds

Great idea. Given the nature of the invasion and the humanitarian crisis that follows as well as potential consequences to the entire world, I would definitely not call this “politics” anymore but rather something that goes in line with Green Money concept. I would more see this going to humanitarian aid than buying arms though.  Big thumbs up.

content.content: I voted NO. I am not disputing the idea, but I think the questions are misleading. I think the questions should be:  Should Maker lend DAI to Ukraine through Monetalis ASAP? If yes, then how much should Maker lend? Is Maker willing to put such amount at risk by lending without the customary structuring diligence that would be typically required, given the harshness of the situation?

content.content: I voted NO, because:  Monetalis, as any other component in the protocol has to pass through a risk analysis. We could also say we can add the Ukrainian airdrop as collateral and give them a 1M loan… I’m all in favor of supporting Ukraine, but a “War Bond” is not neutral. We could support an NGO like MSF by giving them a donation. If we do it, let’s do it because we want to support a cause, not just for PR

content.content: In full support.  Oasis Pro will assist in anyway possible

Voted no. I like the approach but I am not convinced of the purpose of the bonds. As I read it in this article, Ukraine war bonds “will be used to meet the needs of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and to ensure the uninterrupted provision of the state’s financial needs under the war,”. Despite the fact that I also choose to be in favor of the existence of Ukraine, at the end, whichever side is chosen, I don’t like the idea of ​​financing war. I believe that a focus on humanitarian aid directly connected to the victims of war is healthier and more neutral for Maker and Dai. I like the idea of supporting an NGO!

content.content: My vote is no. The guarantees are not given, besides, what is the use of these bonds if Ukraine will already receive 3 billion dollars from the IMF. I see it as mere publicity for the protocol in this conflict, the best thing we can do as we all think here is to donate DAI to some organization that is in charge of helping refugees and I repeat refugees. Directly financing war bonds I don’t think leaves a good precedent for institutional investors.

content.content: Allan_Pedersen:  Given the urgency, you see here two polls, that we will have open only for the next 24 hours.   With such a short time window, this poll seems to flout standard governance practice. I voted No. I’d rather see a donation than a loan because it is much simpler to implement and a loan could be regarded as taking advantage of the situation. Also, I think any donation should also address Putin’s demand to dissolve NATO. It must be acknowledged that the west (USA) has contributed to provoking this war.

content.content: “Flout” seems to be strong word considering the focus of the poll, the exigencies inherent to the situation, and that this is an informal forum poll. I, like others, think that funding armed conflict is problematic and would like to see this focused on refugee aid or rebuilding. That said, I think the DAO is positioned well to take action here, absorb any risk of a surplus-relative small amount, and that the proposal should be driven forward. Hopefully, some contours of the DAO’s action can be better formed in the formal on-chain proposal - which is a possibility since this poll is so indefinite. I also think that we should leave geo-political opinions out of it - hence I would like to see a focus on humanitarian aid/support in whatever this proposal’s final form is.

content.content: I voted yes not because of a particularly strong opinion re the war or buying bonds in support of Ukraine. I voted yes because I would like to see something – anything – that is a real-world asset go through and be approved (or voted on at least). I fear that the complete inertia surrounding RWA poses serious problems for Dai growth, and so any action that even provides a minimal amount of momentum is a welcome step forward. And as an MKR holder that is frustrating.

content.content: @Tosh9.0 sometimes inertia is confused with a professional defensive stance for the good of the protocol. A stance that hides immense work behind it. As a good parent, it is much harder to say no than yes. Still, SES will host a session dedicated to what we have been doing for RWF. Many will participate. And I believe that @williamr is planning at having weekly office hours to give visibility to the community. Plugging real world with permission less defi has never been done. It require immense work and we see already huge improvements. If we want to scale, without the risk of fatal flaws, we need to go deeper beyond forum claims.

content.content: Tosh9.0:  I voted yes because I would like to see something – anything – that is a real-world asset go through and be approved (or voted on at least). I fear that the complete inertia surrounding RWA poses serious problems for Dai growth   If this is your concern, then maybe you can voice it in a separate thread and have a community discussion there. Spending 5M in a project that is unlikely to be executed timely (just for governance reasons, I mean we are MakerDAO) , will be insanely risky, and will not move the needle (either for us of Ukraine) isn’t a good way to voice your concerns. There were complaints about the slowness of RWA in 2020 and @equivrel made a Signal Request, leading to the creation of the RWA WG then the RWF CU, and the onboarding of RWA. So governance actions can have an impact.     luca_pro:  sometimes inertia is confused with a professional defensive stance for the good of the protocol. A stance that hides immense work behind it. As a good parent, it is much harder to say no than yes.   As a DAO, it makes sense to leave the decision-making to the MKR holders (and the definition of what is “good” for the protocol). At the same time, if CUs are taking the decision-making and MKR are not saying anything, well it’s not completely the fault of CUs either.

content.content: They need AA weapons, not money. At least that is my impression.

Thank you to all who have voted so far! Apologies for having not been too much around during this poll to comment and clarify. Below just a few points:   People who would like to propose a Maker donation to a Ukraine-based humanitarian charity I can only encourage to do so. Today I collected and bought clothes, blankets, diapers and foodstuff - and we filled a big horse truck here in St Andrews in Scotland - and tonight two volunteers will start a long drive to the Polish/Ukrainian border to deliver it all. I can only encourage others to do the same. The refugee crisis is quite real.   I clearly should not have written War bond - it wasn’t a deeply considered word choice from my side. Those War Bonds, that seem to have a strong military spending purpose, you read about in the newspaper, I think, were sold out even before I got around to posting this poll. What we are actually doing is working with various parties in Ukraine to figure out ways in which we can provide financing for mainly humanitarian purposes (watersupply, housing, medical supplies, foodstuff etc etc) in the short-term, and potentially redevelopment in the longer term. And that is financing backed by the government (preferably in a bond format). Also, if all else fails, exploring how we can get setup to participate in a straight-forward standard Ukraine government bond round that might be around the corner - all in all we are just trying to be entrepreneurial about it and truly have only started this process a few days ago. At anyrate, any financial instrument we might find/construct, will be duly presented to the community before any transaction can happen.   Monetalis is Green Economy and ESG laser-focused. Not looking to finance rockets and tanks any time soon.

content.content: Declaration of conflict of interest. I have in-law family in Ukraine. Some of which are currently residing in cites being attacked by aerial bombardment and artillery fire. I will therefore not vote in the current poll, but offer some thoughts on the idea. While I have more motivation than most to immediately jump on the idea I think we should consider both some of the opportunities this affords us and some of the risks we take on. In my opinion the greatest opportunity this affords us is to gain political good will. Europe and the US has imposed perhaps the harshest economic sanctions on Russia in history. We are witnessing an unprecedented effect on the Russian economy. Crypto has come under fire as a means for Russia to mitigate parts of those sanctions and thus cause damage to the reputation of crypto in public opinion. There has already been talks about ways to target crypto with sanctions in order to prevent Russia from using it. If this proposal gains approval we should do everything in our power to make it as public as possible to show that Maker can be a force for good. Building on that objective I think Maker should be very careful to be too hasty to get into directly financing war. We should instead clearly focus on humanitarian aid. As is fairly normal in war the civilian population of Ukraine is rapidly running out of basic necessities as well as medicine. There will be a tremendous need for money to pay for this. If we can get recognition for this effort I believe this will also put Maker even more on the map for other actors in RWF and can be a door opener. Even into taking on other forms of sovereign debts which typically fits with Maker’s preferred risk level. Increased recognition can also increase our legal risk. Not all political processes are run in a strictly analytical fashion. Sometimes names that stick out in the media are the ones that end up taking the brunt of the heat once lawmakers gets to writing, or government agencies gets to work. We should also consider the risk of our counterparty in this case. Ukraine even before the war was struggling with corruption. Now there is a reasonable chance that the current government might be forcefully replaced. That has to be balanced by potentially turning a sovereign government into an ally. I firmly believe that in the long run Ukraine is going to emerge from this conflict as a welcomed member of the European community with a reputation for heroism and defiance. Given the unprecedented economic and military support given by the EU and other European states I am convinced that regardless of the devastation brought upon the country it will rise from the ashes in the same way the world witnessed the rise of West-Germany following World War II. Further into the future I believe there is an opportunity in providing credit to the rebuilding effort that must surely follow. One that we might prepare for even now. Personally I believe in Ukraine. I hope Maker will too.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: The problem I see here is that if we are talking about giving 5.000.000 to Ukraine, then you open a door that can lead, logically, to… Why don’t we send 2.000.000 to Virunga national park? Or 3.000.000 to Somalia? Or maybe 5.000.000 to NGOs working on Middle East, where 500.000 civilians were killed in the last years? Or the NGOs fighting against child slavery? Or even… what about a project that takes 5M, subdivides that in portions of 150.000 and then sends the donations to 33 different humanitarian projects around the globe? On the other hand, as @psychonaut said, speaking about a “loan” or any other kind of financial speculation, in situations like these, sounds like taking advantage, even when I’m sure this is not the case here Regarding to the geopolitical side of things I think, @John_Yarwood, that is impossible to avoid; in fact, it is not healthy trying to dismiss the geopolitical and even moral derivations of this kind of issues. As I see it, MakerDAO and the whole DeFi habitat is a geopolitical and a philosopical phenomenon, not just an economic or financial one

content.content: Voted No. I would encourage every individual who would like to donate to Ukraine to do so via their donation address in whatever token you like but as a protocol, Maker should not be picking a side. Second, lending to a country at war with the implicit expectation of being paid back is horrible PR for Maker. Remember how much shit Gavin Wood got for this tweet where he wanted to donate DOT? What we’re proposing is way worse. I know that the intentions here are good but we are going to look no better than loan sharks taking advantage of a country in a desperate situation. If we are financing long-term rebuilding of the nation, that is a non-urgent process that will only start after the war is over. There will be plenty of time to discuss exactly how that should be done and what role Maker can play. Lastly, in terms of process, there appear to be a lot of brand new accounts created after this poll started that have voted on this poll. The poll settings have not set a minimum trust_level score for participation. Please consider these factors before we jump into this decision.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving negative feedback on proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: AstronautThis:  There will be plenty of time to discuss exactly how that should be done and what role Maker can play.   Exactly.     Allan_Pedersen:  Given the urgency, you see here two polls, that we will have open only for the next 24 hours.   I find this sense of urgency totally out of place (and indeed Maker should implement some kind systematic filters against rushed decisions/polls). Emotions rarely help in making good decisions. Perhaps it is better to turn off the TV/twitter for a while. There will be a lot to reconstruct in Ukraine over the next few years and many opportunities to help. (IF THAT IS THE REAL GOAL, as opposed to just PR, which would be doubly-sad).

However, there are good reasons to be conservative and avoid getting the DAO mixed in, without chalking it up to natural inertia. A lot of the rationalizations in favor sound like a hammer in search of a nail. This is usually a tell for good intentions turning into bad outcomes.

content.content: Dear Maker Community, Thank you very much for voting. These are unprecedented times in our world and we appreciate your thoughts, comments and involvement both for and against our proposal. As the vote was close, taking it further would likely require extended debate and, as such, we won’t be moving the proposal any further. We hope by raising the issue much was accomplished in shedding further commuity light on the terrible situation in Ukraine, and uncovering some great ideas from the community on how one could support the Ukrainian people. Thank you! @OasisProTeam (Pat LaVec)  /  @Allan_Pedersen
